Input point mass balance file. Row 1 are headers of each column. Column 1 is mass balance year. Column 2 is site name. Column 3 is the date (mm/mm/yyyy) of spring observations.
Column 4 is the date (mm/dd/yyyy) of fall observations. Column 5 is the site elevation (HAE). Column 6 is the specific winter mass balance in combined time system (Mayo and others, 1972).
Column 7 is the specific annual balance in combine time system. Column 8 is the amount of addditional observed ablation between fall and spring visits. Column 9 is the amount of snow which fell between spring and fall visits.
Column 10 is the temperature(C) of the previous summers surface measured in the spring. All mass balance observations are in meters water equivalent mass. If a observation was not made enter NaN.
Final input file must begin with row 1 as seen in the example below.

bal_year	site_name	date_1	date_2	z	winter	net	winter_ablation(-)	summer_accumulation(+)	spring_ss_temp
1966	A	4/23/1966	9/3/1966	617	0.77	-3.62	NaN	0	0
1966	B	4/23/1966	10/24/1966	1084	1.01	-0.74	NaN	0.26	NaN
1966	C	4/23/1966	10/24/1966	1307	2.06	1.07	NaN	0.46	-3
1967	A	5/26/1967	10/4/1967	616	0.39	-4.95	-1.3	0	0
1967	B	4/4/1967	10/1/1967	1083	0.88	NaN	0	NaN	NaN
1967	C	4/2/1967	10/1/1967	1307	1.95	NaN	0	NaN	-3.25
1968	A	4/4/1968	8/20/1968	615	0.88	-3.08	-0.14	0	0

1968	C	6/6/1968	10/10/1968	1307	2.36	0.78	0	0.34	-3

1969	B	6/5/1969	9/13/1969	1083	2.07	-0.68	-0.49	0	NaN
1969	C	6/3/1969	11/19/1969	1307	2.79	2.4	0	1.21	-4
